column42: The Berlin Cleopatra, a [[Roman sculpture]] of Cleopatra wearing a royal [[diadem]], mid-1st century BC, now in the [[Altes Museum]], Germany{{sfnp|Raia|Sebesta|2017}}{{sfnp|Sabino|Gross-Diaz|2016|}}{{sfnp|Grout|2017b|}}<ref group="note">The sculpture was made around the time of Cleopatra's visits to Rome in 46–44 BC and was discovered in an Italian villa along the [[Via Appia]]. For further validation about the [[commons:Category:Bust of Cleopatra VII in the Altes Museum Berlin|Berlin Cleopatra]], see {{harvtxt|Pina Polo|2013|pp=184–186}}, {{harvtxt|Roller|2010|pp=54, 174–175}}, {{harvtxt|Jones|2006|p=33}}, and {{harvtxt|Hölbl|2001|p=234}}.</ref>

column59: 10 or 12 August 30 BC (aged 39)<ref group="note" name="date of Cleopatra's death">Cleopatra almost certainly died on the 17th day of the Egyptian month [[Mesore]], which corresponds to 10 August in the older [[Roman calendar]], and 12 August in the [[Julian calendar]]. See {{harvtxt|Skeat|1953|pp=98–100}}.</ref>

column42: [[Historiated initial]] depicting Joan of Arc (late 19th-century [[art forgery]], in the style of a 15th-century [[Miniature (illuminated manuscript)|miniature]]){{efn|This historiated initial from the [[Archives Nationales (France)|Archives Nationales]] has been dated to the second half of the {{nobr|15th century}}, but it is now regarded as an [[art forgery]],<ref>{{cite book|language=fr|title=1429 – Jeanne d'Arc, le premier portrait|location=Paris|publisher=Archives Nationales|year=2025|page=17|url=https://s3.fr-par.scw.cloud/an-p0-bucket/an-public/files/D%C3%A9couvrir/Publications/livret/pdf/livret_JDARC_FR.pdf?VersionId=1743503179286599|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite journal|language=fr|last=Meunier|first=Huguette|date=April 2025|title=La vraie Jeanne !|journal=[[L'Histoire]]|issue=530|page=92|url=https://shs.cairn.info/magazine-hist-histoire-2025-4-page-92|url-status=live}}</ref>{{sfn|Contamine|2007|p=[https://journals.ub.uni-heidelberg.de/index.php/fr/article/view/45032 199]|ps=: Cette miniature du XV{{sup|e}} siècle, très soignée (l'étendard correspond exactement à la description que Jeanne d'Arc elle-même en donnera lors de son procès){{nbsp}}... Mais c'est précisément cette exactitude, et cette coïncidence, trop belle pour être vraie, qui éveillent—ou plutôt auraient dû éveiller—les soupçons{{nbsp}}... [This miniature from the 15th century, very neat (the banner corresponds exactly to the description that Joan of Arc herself will give during her trial){{nbsp}}... But it is precisely this exactitude, and this coincidence, too good to be true, which arouses—or rather should have aroused—suspicion{{nbsp}}...]}} most likely produced at the turn of the 19th and {{nobr|20th centuries}} by an anonymous artist, possibly the "[[Spanish Forger]]"<ref>{{cite journal|language=fr|last=Girault|first=Pierre-Gilles|year=2021|title=Faux et faussaires: autour du prétendu "Spanish Forger"|journal={{interlanguage link|Histoire et civilisation du livre|fr}}|issue=17|page=289-302|url=https://revues.droz.org/HCL/article/view/HCL_17_289-302/html|url-status=live}}</ref> or the [[Alsace|Alsatian]] painter and collector {{interlanguage link|Georges Spetz|fr}}, who held it in his collection together with two other strikingly similar miniatures.<ref>Bouzy, Olivier (April 2019). "Remarques sur la tapisserie d'Azeglio" (in French). Orléans: Centre Jeanne d'Arc.</ref>}}

c. {{birth date|1890|09|20}}<ref>[http://www.doctorjazz.co.uk/bapcert.jpg Other dates of birth attributed to Morton include October 20, 1890] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20101121171548/http://doctorjazz.co.uk/bapcert.jpg |date=November 21, 2010 }} and [http://www.doctorjazz.co.uk/draftcards1.html September 13, 1884, the latter of which Morton gave on his WWI draft registration, making him six years older than he is believed to have actually been.] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210210213602/http://www.doctorjazz.co.uk/draftcards1.html |date=February 10, 2021 }}</ref>
